Articles.Content:
The point of this thread: state your KSP success or failure in one line. Bonus points if it is funny.

Example:

*Jebadiah sadly figured out, that gravity also works on high mountain cliffs.*

or

*The Mun mission was a complete success! The next mission will then rescue the people from the previous mission.*

Feel free to be creative. =)
Turns out autopilots of crew shuttles need company, or else they suicide during ascent.
Parachutes
Jeb discovered it was difficult to dock without RCS, but he is sure the dents will hammer out fine.
Jeb found that the ground is harder to see at night, but the surface was lit up for a moment.

Mountains are not opaque vacuums.

Order of staging important is.

1st rule of electrical engineering: It might have worked with a power supply.

2nd rule of electrical engineering: It might not have.
Mashing the spacebar is an acceptable abort sequence.
Jebediah learned that high speeds in low atmosphere result in what is now known as the kerbal-oven effect.
Turns out ''Just add a bunch of parachutes'' is not a safe way of landing a 900 ton ship on Eve.

Low Calorie Super Delicious ship [ready for lunch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124075-NASA-Low-Density-Supersonic-Decelerator-Test-June-3-2015-And-my-KSP-replica-preparing-for-lunch?p=1990632&viewfull=1#post1990632). Tabasco sauce on hot standby. Napkins to preflight condition & fries on the side.
Jeb is now slowly measuring the entire length of space.
It was only supposed to be a test flight.
The said it could not happen, the odds were 1 in a million, but ground control managed to kill the probe with both panels facing away from the sun... Again.
When the craft you're trying to resque is a craft that tried to resque another craft, you're doing it wrong...
OXSTAT can't power worth a damn, and pods don't hold enough RCS for any useful purpose, but the warp key can save the day.

42

/10 chars
They said that part wouldn't fit there... they were right.
A journey through space, a manoeuvre missed in haste, Kerbal's resting place.
"1.0.3 is days, not weeks away." ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Pieces of the fairing are stuck to my ship and now the game thinks I'm on the ground.
Orbit achieved. Circulation complete. Fuel exhausted. Rescue required.
Target biome: polar lowlands; landed: poles; oh well, plane change to station is a lot of margin Jeb can use for a short hop.
30 full seconds into the battle, and we haven't even had a mid-air collision!
Good news: The recovery operation at the launchpad is complete. Bad news: The recovery was of launchpad debris after a large booster landed in it.
